intro: Brassica oleracea var. media, commonly known as cauliflower, is a cultivar of the species Brassica oleracea. It is characterized by its dense, compact flower heads that are typically white, green, or purple. The plant belongs to the mustard family (Brassicaceae) and is closely related to broccoli and cabbage. Its botanical features include thick, waxy leaves and a short, stocky stem. The edible portion consists of the immature flower buds, which are harvested before they open.
